{"step_by_step_thinking": "ECT stands for Electroconvulsive Therapy, a procedure used to treat certain psychiatric conditions. It involves passing a carefully controlled electric current through the brain. The most common side effect of ECT is memory loss. There are two types of memory loss: anterograde amnesia, which is the inability to form new memories, and retrograde amnesia, which is the inability to remember information that was learned before the onset of the amnesia. In the context of ECT, retrograde amnesia is more common.", "answer_choice": "B. Retrograde amnesia"}
